reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sure it’s not Literature but it’s funny…
reviews.reviewText: Sometimes I really wonder what people are expecting when they buy a graphic novel aimed at early readers. My kids are both very reluctant readers. I’ll buy them whatever book gets them to read.Yes, this book has ton of fart jokes. Do my kids love it. 100%. So if you’re looking for a graphic novel for your child or grandchild who does not love to read. This is the book for you. It gets kids engaged with beautiful illustrations and a silly story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fabulous fun for the family!
reviews.reviewText: This book was a delight to read! First, the plot brought me back to being a kid when anything and everything was possible. And then embellishing the storyline with wit and humor playfully woven in - it was a joy to read as an adult and imagine any young reader could fully relate to the characters and emersed into the story and subtle messages. It was brilliantly done! Brava!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must have on your kids shelves!
reviews.reviewText: Stella and Astrid are the sweetest friends! A unicorn and a flying squirrel who are making new friends and are travelling the world. We love the robot as well! The pictures are colorful, it's a funny story with positive messages for our kids. I just ordered a second copy for friends. Get it, you can't go wrong!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A fun read!
reviews.reviewText: fun - my K loved the punny jokes. He can't get a lot of jokes so loved being able to understand these. Super fun drawings!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My daughter loves this book, so cute and very well illustrated!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gorgeous illustration + important life lessons = win!
reviews.reviewText: I bought this book Cosmic Adventures of Astrid & Stella and the sequel part 2 (on preorder) for the library at our youth dojo, and the kids love it! The illustrations are gorgeous and the full color saturation and all the scenery details really take kids' imagination away to another planet as they go on the adventures with the characters. As a teacher, I appreciate the hidden life lessons, "We can do hard things!" and everyone needs a break now and then, as the characters set goals, do tasks to prepare, undertake the project even when it gets hard, give themselves a break to refresh through self-care, and ultimately accomplish their goal, with a reward. The writing is fun and upbeat and full of silly & smart puns, and with the beautiful landscapes reading this book was like being in a technicolor dreamscape of unicorns and ice cream in outer space, but with substance. All the products from HelloLucky! are just darling and so thoughtful and high quality, I also got the advent calendar 'Tis the season for Elf-Care, and regularly love their stationary full of puns and bright colors and amazing lettering. Plus you're supporting a pair of sisters' small business, win-win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Silly quirky fun
reviews.reviewText: Love this book - it's rollicking fun like Narwal & Jelly but full of positive messages about persistence, optimism, resilience and believing in yourself. It's also that perfect sweet spot of story + graphics for kids who need a little more sophistication in their storytelling/reading but are perhaps not into full blown chapter books. Love the puns & Astrid, Stella & their robot pal are all hilarious!! Love it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars This is.. literature?
reviews.reviewText: The book itself is eye catching. It’s very colorful and fun to look at. The illustrations or graphic art is very cute. The characters are cute enough. It’s like very kitschy and…. well, cute.The problems that I have with this graphic novel almost warrant returning it. I feel bad because I’m sure a lot of hard work goes into making a book. I actually really would like to return it and I might. Maybe I’ll donate it to a library but here’s why I struggled with it:So the biggest problem that I had was that the storylines are SO. CHAOTIC. There is no moral. There is no real story even. There are three chapters and they are just full of fluff with little attempts and puns and quips but it just falls so flat in the actual dialogue and story of the book. It’s like there’s just nothing to this book like I feel like I didn’t even read anything.The only place I could ever feel like this book would do well is maybe in a library. Or maybe if a child is just gaining confidence in reading. I have felt more satisfied after reading a little newspaper comic than I did after reading this. But I just feel like it was so boring and pointless. I felt really disappointed because again so cute and colorful it could have been great! If you’re familiar with Mo Willems- like elephant and piggie- that was the kind of dry humor I was going into this hoping for. But it just went nowhere. I know it sounds harsh but they could’ve come up with so many better ideas for actual stories. It was just random puns and a strange colorful abyss of nothingness. Bloop blooper what the heck is that it’s just nonsense and not the fun kind.I bought it for a 7 year old niece for Christmas. Part of me wants to see what she thinks of it. Part of me feels like her brain will feel mushy after reading this disorganized, random, acid trip of a book.I genuinely think the positive reviews for this book know the creators personally because I can’t understand their endearments otherwise.
A great book! Great graphics and storyline. Huge hit for my 6 year old.
